sentences: Onu ikka onu, mõtlesin, vennapojale kohe teenistust muretsemas.
.. sõidame mõneks päevaks maale ühe onu juurde, kes .. on ema vend ja niiviisi minu pärisonu.
Onu, aidake mul uks lahti keerata.
context: The Estonian word 'onu' means uncle, referring to either the mother's or father's brother. It can also be used as a respectful form of address when speaking to an older man or stranger, similar to 'sir' in English but with familial connotations. In children's language, it may refer to any elderly male acquaintance.
